issues.title: HMAC Signature Generation Vulnerability
issues.remediation_steps: Use a different hash function that is not vulnerable to collision attacks.
issues.issue_description: The code uses HMAC with SHA-256, which is vulnerable to collision attacks. This means that an attacker can create two different messages that have the same HMAC signature as the original message.
issues.short_description: HMAC with SHA-256 is vulnerable to collision attacks.

issues.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
issues.remediation_steps: Use prepared statements or parameterized queries to mitigate SQL injection attacks.
issues.issue_description: The code uses user-supplied input directly in an SQL query, making it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. An attacker could manipulate the input to execute malicious SQL code.
issues.short_description: SQL injection vulnerability in user input handling

issues.title: Flask application vulnerability: Sensitive data exposure due to missing CSP header
issues.remediation_steps: Implement a Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header in the Flask application to mitigate the risk of cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
issues.issue_description: The Flask application does not have a Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header defined in the application code. This makes it vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, as malicious users can inject arbitrary JavaScript code into the application's output.
issues.short_description: Missing CSP header

issues.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in user input handling
issues.remediation_steps: Sanitize user input before displaying it in the output to prevent malicious code injection.
issues.issue_description: The application displays user-submitted text without proper sanitization, making it vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. An attacker could inject malicious JavaScript code into the input field, which would be reflected back to the browser and potentially executed by other users.
issues.short_description: User input is not properly sanitized, leading to potential XSS vulnerability.
issues.code_snippet: <input class="w3-input w3-border" type="text" name="text" placeholder="What are you thinking?">

issues.title: Sensitive Keylogging Vulnerability
issues.remediation_steps: Avoid sending sensitive keystrokes to remote servers or implement proper input validation and sanitization techniques.
issues.issue_description: The code snippet implements a keylogger that transmits each keystroke to a remote server at 'http://127.0.0.1:8000/keys'. This poses a significant risk as an attacker could intercept these keystrokes and steal sensitive information such as login credentials or personal data.
issues.short_description: Vulnerable code transmits keystrokes to a remote server.

issues.title: JWT Authentication Vulnerability
issues.remediation_steps: Use shorter expiration time for JWT tokens
issues.issue_description: The JWT token is valid for 1 minute, which increases the risk of an attacker exploiting the vulnerability before it expires. An attacker could potentially hijack a valid token and impersonate a legitimate user.
issues.short_description: JWT token expiration time is too long
